content.description:
Ding Dong Ditch ascends a slightly overhanging section of bomber rock that ends too soon but delivers some entertainment.

Sit start with a good left hand edge/pinch and a sloping right hand edge. From there, pull up to a right hand crimp (crux), follow with the left to a three-finger pocket. Then hit the jug at the lip, and top it out.

The shelf out left of the problem is off, though the line doesn't naturally stray that way anyway.
content.protection: A pad or two will do it, the landing is good, but there a few rocks behind the fall zone.
content.location: It ascends the east face of Denizen Rock.

content.description:
Campfire Drone Expression climbs a slightly overhung arete on solid edges over a great landing.

Sit start with hands on edges on both side of the arete. From there, make a quick pull to achieve the good left foot edge, then make a big left hand move to a three-finger edge (crux?), follow with the right hand to a two-finger edge (crux?). Then negotiate the remaining edges to gain the jug just over the lip on the right side, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will do it, the landing is fantastic.
content.location: It ascends the northeast arete of Denizen Rock.
